detaileddescription.para: The code documentation for this assignment can be found here.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: In the second assignment of the Experimental Robotics Laboratory course, we were requested to integrate the architecture developed in the 1st assignment (by modifyig it, eventually) with a robotic simulation.

sect1.title: Software architecture
sect1.para: The user can find a detailed description of the software architecture that was used here.

However, some changes were done:
The author did some changes in the planner and controller nodes by author Luca Buoncompagni
in the planner the via points that are calculated are taken from the linspace between the start position of the robot (the first via point) and the target position (the last via point);
in the controller node the robot is ctually controlled through the move_base simple action client in order to reach the last via point, which is the target.
the goal that is sent to the planner is the actual room the the robot is required to reach

sect2.title: Installation
sect2.para:
To correctly use this software, the user must follow these steps to install the required packages/repositories.
Given that the author decided to use the file topological_map.owl from the repository topological_map (by author Luca Buoncompagni), the user must clone the mentioned repository and the current one in the ROS workspace.
Install the aRMOR package by following this tutorial.
Clone the armor_py_api repository in your ROS workspace.
Perform what is described in these notes.
Install the SMACH package by running sudo apt-get install ros-noetic-executive-smach* or equivalent for your ROS distribution.
Run chmod +x <file_name> for each file inside the folder scripts of the package ExpRoLab_Assignment2.
Run catkin_make from the root of your ROS workspace.

sect2.title: Running
sect2.para: To correctly use launch file, the user must install xterm with the following command lines: sudoapt-getupdate sudoapt-get-yinstallxterm
Now, the user can launch the program frome the source of the ROS workspace with the following command: roslaunchExpRoLab_Assignment2assignment.launch

sect2.title: Limitations and future technical improvement
sect2.para: The detection of the markers is thought only for this particular environment, so if the user were to use marker_detect.cpp for another environment, it would not work. Therefore, a possible improvement could be to implement a solution that is as general as possible, in order to use it with whatever environment we have at hand.

Another limitation is the robot itself, given that the author opted for a very easy solution. A possible improvement could be to buil a more sophisticated robot or tu use the URDF of a commercial robot.
